messages.message:
*Feature Request:*  
Can we add a chat feature for Instabase Documentation page? I am Attaching a screenshot of the Google API documentation Page for reference.

Hey, @Nithin! We are waiting for the URL functionality before we can launch something like this --- otherwise it would fall out of sync very fast. We’ll also need some eng support to implement it… are you volunteering? :wink:

Seriously, though, @Varun Jain and I were just discussing this last night.

This will be a good usecase for URL import.
To clarify - for URL import the current design will not auto update the improted URLs - it will import a snapshot of the scraped web pages which can then be queried.
The updates will have to be done by the app/conversation owner - which could be a simple button click.
That’s good to know, @Aayush. It still beats downloading (from the source) and uploading (to AI Hub) all the HTML every time we update the docs, which is almost daily. :slightly_smiling_face:

Thanks @jean /@Aayush for introducing me to the new URL functionality. I was not aware of this feature and happy to use this to built the app to integrate with Instabase Docs.

When will this functionality be available for testing?
Nithin it's in planning/exploration phase right now. We are planning to release it with 24.16.
@Aayush - Is it possible for me to get access to the design doc, would like to follow.

For the URL functionality, is it already a part of the plan to (eventually) *add a scheduler-like function to update the data on a regular basis instead of only being dependent on the app owner to do so*?  Or if not can we add this to the plan?

For example, a dropdown could let you choose to have the data update from the URL on a daily, weekly, or monthly basis the same as if a person logged into the app interface on a daily/weekly/monthly basis and clicked the update button.
